title: Cat. 30  Milk Pot, 1765/75
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Bancroft Woodcock (American, 1732–1817)  
Wilmington, Delaware  
Silver; 10.5 × 6.4 × 10.8 cm (4 1/8 × 2 1/2 × 4 1/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society, 1978.138

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom (fig. 30.1)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Firestone and Parson, Boston, by 1978.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1978.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, A Decade of Decorative Arts: The Antiquarian Society of the Art Institute of Chicago, November 12, 1986–January 4, 1987, pp. 81–82, 81 (ill.), cat. 56.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Naeve et al. (1986), p. 81 (ill.), cat. 56.

Barter et al. (1998), pp. 97–99, cat. 32 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Milk Pot, 1765/75.

fig. 30.1 </section>
